result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Logan J. Lenz

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 6, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Logan J Lenz
Current: PO Box 200, c/o Fox Lake Correctional Institution, Fox Lake, WI 53933-0200 United States  (Effective: 11-01-2022)
Prior: 411 S Center Avenue, c/o Jefferson County Jail, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States

[MK] cases #21CF54, #21CF198, #21CM102, #22CF54, #22CF259 called at 10:28am 
Defendant Logan J. Lenz not in court. DA Monica Hall in court for the State of Wisconsin
These cases are scheduled for status-of-PD-counsel type hearings today, and case #21CF198 is scheduled for arraignment.  The Court notes that the Public Defenders Office recently filed a status-update. 
The Court issues a Bench Warrants in all files, returnable to any Jefferson County magistrate. The Court finds that Bond is in default.
recess 10:30am
[Post-Hearing/Off Record:  the Court learns that Mr. Lenz was transported here by JESO this morning for the hearing.  The Court vacates its warrant order and bond-finding, and directs that another status counsel be scheduled.]

NEXT:  JA is to schedule a Status Conference (status-of-counsel hearing) in the cases, and schedule Arraignment in case #21CF198; arrangements are to be made for Mr. Lenz to appear by video-conference for the hearing
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT - 295 contacts and no attorney has accepted the appointment.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[ma] Cases 21CF54, 21CF198, 21CM102, 22CF54, 22CF259 called at 9:00 AM 
Defendant Logan J. Lenz in court, in custody.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court reviews court record, including that Mr. Lenz is public defender eligible, but no attorney has been appointed. 

The Court adjourns to allow counsel to be appointed. 
recess: 9:06am 
NEXT: As to Cases 21CF54, 21CM102,22CF54,22CF259, Status Conference on 10/31/22 at 10:00am 
As to Case 21CF198, Arraignment on 10/31/22 at 10:00am
Status conference on August 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ma] Cases 21CF54, 21CF198,21CM102,22CF54 called at 9:20 AM 
Defendant Logan J. Lenz in court, in custody with Attorney John A. Chavez.  Michael C. Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On Atty Chavez's Motion to Withdraw: 
--Mr. Lenz does not object to motion to withdraw
--the Court will sign order, excuses Atty Chavez [exits at 9:21am]

Scheduling is discussed. 

recess: 9:24am 
NEXT: Status on 8/25/22 at 9:00am (Arraignment needed in 21CF198/Prelim stage in 22CF54)

[ma] Cases 21CF54, 21CF198, 21CM102, 22CF54 called at 1:29 PM 
Defendant Logan J. Lenz appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Initial Appearance occurs in Case 22CF54:
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

Bond Arguments for ALL Cases given

The Court requires a $250 CASH Bond in each case (for a total of $1000)with conditions, if any, to continue. 

recess 1:38  pm. 

NEXT: Arraignment(22CF54)/Status Conference on 6/21/22 at 8:30am
